action.action-desc: Mr. Issa introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Energy and Commerce

form.official-title: To make exclusive the authority of the Federal Government to regulate the labeling of products made in the United States and introduced in interstate or foreign commerce, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Reinforcing American-Made Products Act of 2017.

section.header: Exclusivity of Federal authority to regulate labeling of products made in the United States and introduced in interstate or foreign commerce
section.text: Section 320933 of the Violent Crime Control and Law Enforcement Act of 1994 (15 U.S.C. 45a) is amendedâ€”

paragraph.text: in the first sentence, by striking To the extent and inserting the following:
by adding at the end the following:

subsection.text: The provisions of this section shall supersede any provisions of the law of any State relating to the extent to which a product is introduced, delivered for introduction, sold, advertised, or offered for sale in interstate or foreign commerce with a Made in the U.S.A. or Made in America label, or the equivalent thereof, in order to represent that such product was in whole or substantial part of domestic origin.

paragraph.text: in the third sentence of subsection (a), as designated by paragraph (1), by striking Nothing in this section and inserting Except as provided in subsection (b), nothing in this section.
